option.value: Changing Passive Voice to Active Voice - Differing Passive from Active

slidelink.displaytext: Grammar Lesson - Active and Passive Tone
Determining the difference between passive and active voice
Understanding the Effect of Passive Voice

search.slidetext: changing passive voice to active voice improving your writing skills one part-of-speech at a time! next

lesson overview learning objectives identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. determining the difference between passive and active voice. creating sentences with active voice. changing sentences from passive voice to active voice. start
determining the difference between passive and active voice. objective 2

the piano was played by taylor. passive voice is a sentence arranged to make the subject receive action, rather than the object. what is passive voice? determining the difference between passive and active voice.

what is passive voice? determining the difference between passive and active voice. passive voice is a sentence arranged to make the subject receive action, rather than the object. the piano was played by taylor. object

what is passive voice? determining the difference between passive and active voice. passive voice is a sentence arranged to make the subject receive action, rather than the object. the piano was played by taylor. object verb / action

what is passive voice? determining the difference between passive and active voice. passive voice is a sentence arranged to make the subject receive action, rather than the object. the piano was played by taylor. object verb / action subject

incorrect incorrect. make sure to identify the verb and what is performing the action of the verb. that will be the subject. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! the team is the thing that is performing the action of the verb of lost. continue continue continue continue continue continue type your text here type in the subject of the below sentence. determining the difference between passive and active voice. a game was lost by the team.

what is passive voice? determining the difference between passive and active voice. the piano was played by taylor. the subject is at the end of the sentence, rather than at the front. the flaw of passive voice is that it takes the focus away from the subject and places it on the object. this leads to weak and unclear writing.

summary: determining the difference between passive and active voice. identify the voice of a sentence by finding the subject. passive voice sentences place the object at the front and the subject at the end. your sentences may be unclear and weak in the passive voice.
time to practice determining the difference between passive and active voice. let’s go!

terms.term: Active Voice is a sentence showing the SUBJECT performing the action of the VERB. The SUBJECT will usually be at the front of this type of sentence.
Something in the sentence that is being acted on by the subject.
Passive voice is a sentence arranged to make the SUBJECT receive action, rather than the OBJECT.
The person, place, or thing performing the action.
The action being done in the sentence, usually by the subject.
